document_data.name: Llorbauth
document_data.mainbody:
'''Llorbauth''' was the capital of the kingdom of [[Erlkazar]] in the [[Lands of Intrigue]].
{{TOC limit|3}}
document_data.Description: Llorbauth was the largest city in Erlkazar, with a population of 28,000 in {{Yearlink|1370}}.
document_data.Geography: The city was located in [[Shalanar]] Barony, It was surrounded by agricultural fields.
document_data.Government: The city and its country were ruled by King [[Korox Morkann]] in 1370.
document_data.Trade:
The capital city had official trade deals with [[Nimpeth]], [[Ormpetarr]], and several other ports in the [[Vilhon Reach]], by means of the Deepwash and the [[Wintercloak River]]. A full 40 percent of the nation's sea trade came through this city, and the king controlled trade coming in and out of the port and the majority of the agricultural trade as well.

Llorbauth was famous for a particular [[beer]] brewed in the city, known as [[Old One Eye]], which was particularly popular among [[adventurer]]s south of [[Cormyr]].

Notable Locations.[[Hills' Cheer Distillery & Brewery]]: The source of Old One Eye.
Notable Locations.[[Lost Lovers' Pool]]: A sea cave located north of the city.
Notable Locations.The [[Mystics' Academy]]: A school of magic located south of the city.
Notable Locations.The [[Lore Halls]]:
A temple to [[Oghma]].

The [[Harpers]] also maintained a [[teleportation circle]] in a safe house somewhere in the city.{{Cite dragon/211/"I Sing a Song by the Deep-Water Bay"|32}}

document_data.Inhabitants:
* King [[Korox Morkann]], the city's ruler.
* [[Gamalon Idogyr]], later Court Sage of Tethyr.
* [[Araneth Idogyr]], Gamalon's brother and the owner of Hills' Cheer.
* [[Damlath]], a [[wizard]] follower of Oghma.
* [[Alcedor Kolat|Alcedor]] and [[Duhlark Kolat]], twin brother wizards later living in [[Waterdeep]].
* [[Alairtelle Mistrym]], a noble and author of the book, ''[[Thoughts for Ladies Fair]]''.{{Cite web/The Candlekeep Collection}}
document_data.History:
The king's castle of Klarsamryn was 500 years older than most of the rest of the city.

In the {{YearlinkName|1366}}, a floating mountainous fortress, known as the [[Obsidian Ridge]], appeared over the city of Llorbauth.

After the [[Spellplague]], because of the machinations of a [[vampire]]ss named [[Saestra Karanok]], the city dwindled in population to fewer than 10,000.
